description: a(n) = smallest integer m such that Sum_{k=1..m} prime(k) is divisible by n.
comments: It follows from a theorem of Daniel Shiu that m always exists. See A111287 for details. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 05 2005
references: Felice Russo, A set of new Smarandache functions, sequences and conjectures in number theory, American Research Press 2000
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
D. K. L. Shiu, Strings of Congruent Primes, J. Lond. Math. Soc. 61 (2) (2000) 359-373 [MR1760689]
maple: read transforms; M:=1000; p0:=[seq(ithprime(i),i=1..M)]; q0:=PSUM(p0); w:=[]; for n from 1 to M do p:=n; hit := 0; for i from 1 to M do if q0[i] mod p = 0 then w:=[op(w),i]; hit:=1; break; fi; od: if hit = 0 then break; fi; od: w;
prog: (Haskell)a053050 n = head [k | (k, x) <- zip [1..] a007504_list, mod x n == 0]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 04 2015, Feb 10 2012
author: _Felice Russo_, Feb 25 2000
extensions: More terms from _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 05 2005
